world.item

Class Item

  • java.lang.Object
    • world.item.Item
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DatabaseManager.DatabaseEntry

    public class Item
extends java.lang.Object
implements DatabaseManager.DatabaseEntry
    Holds data for a standard item, whether it be a sword, a chair, or a potion. The type of item is decided by the value returned by getItemType() and will be one of the TYPE_* constants declared in ItemStatTable. They are not declared here as item instances do not have their own stat definitions. Stats are determined by the item name, as such all Iron Swords will have the same stats.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Item

        public Item(java.lang.String itemName,
            java.lang.String databaseName)
        constructor for a new item. !Automatically persists itself! to avoid the possibility of more than one item with the same id
        Parameters:
        itemName - the name of the item, used to get the item's stats
        databaseName - the name of the database containing the item's stats. item is stored in that database

      • Item

        public Item(java.lang.String itemName,
            java.lang.String displayName,
            java.lang.String databaseName)
        constructor for a new item. !Automatically persists itself! to avoid the possibility of more than one item with the same id
        Parameters:
        itemName - the name of the item, used to get the item's stats
        displayName - the custom displayed name for the item
        databaseName - the name of the database containing the item's stats. item is stored in that database

      • getContainerID

        public int getContainerID()

      • setContainerID

        public void setContainerID(int containerID)
        stores the item in the container with the given ID. NOTE!!!, this ignores any constraints that the container may have. Do not manually place items inside of containers with this method. Instead, use the tryStoreItem() of the container. This method will null out the entityID and the roomName of the item, to show the location of the item is dependant on that of the container it is stored in. Persists changes automatically
